name: Fluxzero
documentation:
High-level entry point for all interactions with the Fluxzero Runtime.

This interface exposes static convenience methods to publish and track messages, interact with aggregates, schedule tasks, index/search documents, and more. It is designed to reduce boilerplate and promote location transparency in message-driven systems.

Usage Patterns

  • To send or publish messages, use static methods such as {@link #sendCommand(Object)} or {@link #publishEvent(Object)}.
  • To track incoming messages, register handlers using {@link #registerHandlers(Object...)}.
  • To interact with aggregates, use {@link #loadAggregate(Id)} or {@link #aggregateRepository()}.

Most applications will never need to hold or inject a {@code Fluxzero} instance directly. Instead, the Java SDK automatically binds the relevant instance to a thread-local scope, allowing access via static methods.

A concrete instance is typically constructed using {@link DefaultFluxzero}.

fields.name: applicationInstance
fields.documentation:
Fluxzero instance set by the current application. Used as a fallback when no threadlocal instance was set. This
 is added as a convenience for applications that never have more than one than Fluxzero instance which will be the
 case for nearly all applications. On application startup simply fill this application instance.

fields.name: instance
fields.documentation:
Thread-local binding of the current {@code Fluxzero} instance.

This is automatically set during message processing to ensure that handlers can invoke commands, queries, or schedule events without explicitly injecting dependencies.

Example: Inside a {@code @HandleCommand} method, you can call {@code Fluxzero.sendCommand(...)} and it will automatically use the correct instance, without needing manual wiring.

methods.name: aggregateRepository
methods.documentation: Returns a client to assist with event sourcing.

methods.name: apply
methods.documentation: Applies the given function with this Fluxzero set as current threadlocal instance.

methods.name: asEntity
methods.documentation:
Returns an Entity containing given value. The returned entity won't exhibit any side effects when they are
 updated, i.e. they won't be synced to any repository or give rise to any events. Other than, that they are fully
 functional.

methods.name: beforeShutdown
methods.documentation: Register a task to run before this Fluxzero instance is closed.

methods.name: cache
methods.documentation: Returns the cache used by the client to cache aggregates etc.

methods.name: cancelSchedule
methods.documentation: Cancels the schedule with given {@code scheduleId}.

methods.name: client
methods.documentation:
Returns the low level client used by this Fluxzero instance to interface with the Fluxzero Runtime. Of course the
 returned client may also be a stand-in for the actual service.

methods.name: clock
methods.documentation: Returns the clock used by Fluxzero to generate timestamps.

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Closes this Fluxzero instance gracefully.

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Closes this Fluxzero instance gracefully. If silently is true, shutdown is done without logging.

methods.name: commandGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for command messages.

methods.name: configuration
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link FluxzeroConfiguration} of this Fluxzero instance.

methods.name: correlationDataProvider
methods.documentation: Returns the provider of correlation data for published messages.

methods.name: currentClock
methods.documentation:
Gets the clock of the current Fluxzero instance (obtained via {@link #getOptionally()}). If there is no current
 instance the system's UTC clock is returned.

methods.name: currentCorrelationData
methods.documentation:
Gets the current correlation data, which by default depends on the current {@link Client}, {@link Tracker} and
 {@link DeserializingMessage}

methods.name: currentIdentityProvider
methods.documentation:
Fetches the configured identity provider used for both functional and technical IDs. The default is a {@link UuidFactory} that generates UUIDs.

If there is no current Fluxzero instance, a new UUID factory is generated.

methods.name: currentTime
methods.documentation:
Gets the time according to the current Fluxzero clock (obtained via {@link #currentClock()}). If there is no
 current Fluxzero instance the system's UTC time is returned.

methods.name: customGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for given custom message topic.

methods.name: deleteCollection
methods.documentation: Deletes a search collection if it exists.

methods.name: deleteDocument
methods.documentation: Deletes the document with given id in given collection if it exists.

methods.name: documentStore
methods.documentation: Returns a client for the document search service offered by Fluxzero.

methods.name: downcast
downcast
errorGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for any error messages published while handling a command or query.

methods.name: eventGateway
methods.documentation:
Returns the message gateway for application events. Use {@link #aggregateRepository()} to publish events
 belonging to an aggregate.

methods.name: eventStore
methods.documentation: Returns the store for aggregate events.

methods.name: execute
methods.documentation: Executes the given task with this Fluxzero set as current threadlocal instance.

methods.name: filterContent
methods.documentation:
Modify given value before it's passed to the given viewer. See {@link FilterContent} for info on how to filter
 the value.

methods.name: generateId
generateId
methods.documentation:
Generates a strongly typed ID of given {@code idClass} using the current {@link IdentityProvider}.

 @return a unique, traceable typed identifier

methods.name: get
methods.documentation:
Returns the Fluxzero instance bound to the current thread or else set by the current application. Throws an
 exception if no instance was registered.

methods.name: getDocument
methods.documentation:
Fetches a document by id using the associated type to determine the collection. The result is deserialized into
 the stored type.

methods.name: getDocument
methods.documentation: Gets the document with given id in given collection type, returning the value.

methods.name: getDocument
methods.documentation: Gets the document with given id in given collection, returning the value in the type that it was stored.

methods.name: getDocument
methods.documentation:
Gets the document with given id in given collection, converting the matching document to a value with given
 type.

methods.name: getDocuments
methods.documentation: Gets a collection of documents by their IDs from the given collection type.

methods.name: getDocuments
methods.documentation:
Gets a collection of documents by their IDs from the given collection and deserializes them into the stored
 type.

methods.name: getDocuments
methods.documentation: Gets a collection of documents by their IDs, converting the matching documents to value with the given type.

methods.name: getOptionally
methods.documentation:
Returns the Fluxzero client bound to the current thread or else set by the current application as Optional.
 Returns an empty Optional if no instance was registered.

methods.name: hasDocument
methods.documentation:
Checks whether a document exists for the given identifier and its associated type. The type is used to determine
 the document collection.

methods.name: hasDocument
methods.documentation: Checks if a document exists in the specified collection.

methods.name: idForName
identityProvider
methods.documentation: Returns the factory used by Fluxzero to generate identifiers.

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given object for search.

If the object is annotated with {@link Searchable @Searchable} the collection name and any timestamp or end path defined there will be used.

If the object has a property annotated with {@link EntityId}, it will be used as the id of the document. Otherwise, a random id will be assigned to the document.

This method returns once the object is stored. @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses. @see Searchable for ways to define collection name etc

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given object for search.

If the object has a property annotated with {@link EntityId}, it will be used as the id of the document. Otherwise, a random id will be assigned to the document.

This method returns once the object is stored. @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses.

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given object for search. This method returns once the object is stored.

 @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses.

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given object for search. This method returns once the object is stored.

 @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses.

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given object for search. This method returns once the object is stored.

 @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses.

methods.name: index
methods.documentation:
Index given objects for search. Use {@code idFunction} to provide the document's required id. Use {@code timestampFunction} and {@code endFunction} to provide the object's timestamp. If none are supplied the document will not be timestamped.

This method returns once all objects are stored. @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses.

methods.name: keyValueStore
methods.documentation: Returns a client for the key value service offered by Fluxzero.

methods.name: loadAggregate
methods.documentation:
Loads the aggregate root of type {@code } with given aggregateId.

If the aggregate is loaded while handling an event of the aggregate, the returned Aggregate will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the aggregate is loaded. @see Aggregate for more info on how to define an event-sourced aggregate root

methods.name: loadAggregate
methods.documentation:
Loads the aggregate root with the given aggregateId. If the aggregate exists, it will be loaded and returned with its respective type, if not, an empty {@link Entity} of type {@link Object} will be returned.

If the aggregate is loaded while handling an event of the aggregate, the returned Aggregate will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the aggregate is loaded. @see Aggregate for more info on how to define an event-sourced aggregate root

methods.name: loadAggregate
methods.documentation:
Loads the aggregate root of type {@code } with given aggregateId.

If the aggregate is loaded while handling an event of the aggregate, the returned Aggregate will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the aggregate is loaded. @see Aggregate for more info on how to define an event-sourced aggregate root

methods.name: loadAggregateFor
methods.documentation:
Loads the aggregate root that currently contains the entity with given entityId. If no such aggregate exists an empty aggregate root is returned of type {@code Object}. In that case be aware that applying events to create the aggregate may yield an undesired result; to prevent this use {@link #loadAggregateFor(Object, Class)}.

This method can also be used if the entity is the aggregate root (aggregateId is equal to entityId). If the entity is associated with more than one aggregate the behavior of this method is unpredictable, though the default behavior is that any one of the associated aggregates is returned.

If the aggregate is loaded while handling an event of the aggregate, the returned Aggregate will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the aggregate is loaded. @see Aggregate for more info on how to define an event-sourced aggregate root

methods.name: loadAggregateFor
methods.documentation:
Loads the aggregate root of type {@code } that currently contains the entity with given entityId. If no such aggregate exists an empty aggregate root is returned with given {@code defaultType} as its type.

This method can also be used if the entity is the aggregate root (aggregateId is equal to entityId). If the entity is associated with more than one aggregate the behavior of this method is unpredictable, though the default behavior is that any one of the associated aggregates is returned.

If the aggregate is loaded while handling an event of the aggregate, the returned Aggregate will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the aggregate is loaded. @see Aggregate for more info on how to define an event-sourced aggregate root

methods.name: loadEntity
methods.documentation:
Loads the entity with given id. If the entity is not associated with any aggregate yet, a new aggregate root is loaded with the entityId as aggregate identifier. In case multiple entities are associated with the given entityId the most recent entity is returned.

If the entity is loaded while handling an event its aggregate, the returned entity will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the entity is loaded.

methods.name: loadEntity
methods.documentation:
Loads the entity with given id. If the entity is not associated with any aggregate yet, a new aggregate root is loaded with the entityId as aggregate identifier. In case multiple entities are associated with the given entityId the most recent entity is returned.

If the entity is loaded while handling an event its aggregate, the returned entity will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the entity is loaded.

methods.name: loadEntityValue
methods.documentation:
Loads the current entity value for given entity id. Entity may be the aggregate root or any ancestral entity. If no such entity exists or its value is not set {@code null} is returned.

If the entity is loaded while handling an event its aggregate, the returned entity will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the entity is loaded.

methods.name: loadEntityValue
methods.documentation:
Loads the current entity value for given entity id. Entity may be the aggregate root or any ancestral entity. If no such entity exists or its value is not set {@code null} is returned.

If the entity is loaded while handling an event its aggregate, the returned entity will automatically be played back to the event currently being handled. Otherwise, the most recent state of the entity is loaded.

methods.name: messageScheduler
methods.documentation:
Returns the gateway to schedule messages.

 @see MessageType#SCHEDULE

methods.name: metricsGateway
methods.documentation:
Returns the gateway for metrics events. Metrics events can be published in any form to log custom performance
 metrics about an application.

methods.name: prepareIndex
methods.documentation:
Prepare given object for indexing for search. This returns a mutable builder that allows defining an id, collection, etc.

If the object is annotated with {@link Searchable @Searchable} the collection name and any timestamp or end path defined there will be used.

If the object has a property annotated with {@link EntityId}, it will be used as the id of the document. Otherwise, a random id will be assigned to the document.

This method returns once the object is stored. @see DocumentStore for more advanced uses. @see Searchable for ways to define collection name etc

methods.name: propertySource
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link PropertySource} configured for this Fluxzero instance.

methods.name: publishEvent
methods.documentation:
Publishes the given application event. The event may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be published as is. Otherwise the event is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

Note: These events are not persisted for event sourcing. To publish domain events as part of an aggregate lifecycle, apply the events using {@link Entity#apply} after loading an entity.

@see #aggregateRepository() if you're interested in publishing events that belong to an aggregate.

methods.name: publishEvent
methods.documentation:
Publishes an event with given payload and metadata.

Note: These events are not persisted for event sourcing. To publish domain events as part of an aggregate lifecycle, apply the events using {@link Entity#apply} after loading an entity.

@see #publishEvent(Object) for more info

methods.name: publishEvents
methods.documentation:
Publishes given application events. The events may be instances of {@link Message} in which case they will be published as is. Otherwise, the events are published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

Note: These events are not persisted for event sourcing. To publish domain events as part of an aggregate lifecycle, apply the events using {@link Entity#apply} after loading an entity.

@see #aggregateRepository() if you're interested in publishing events that belong to an aggregate.

methods.name: publishMetrics
methods.documentation:
Publishes a metrics event. The parameter may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise the metrics event is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

Metrics events can be published in any form to log custom performance metrics about an application.

methods.name: publishMetrics
methods.documentation:
Publishes a metrics event with given payload and metadata. Metrics events can be published in any form to log
 custom performance metrics about an application.

methods.name: query
methods.documentation:
Sends the given query and returns a future that will be completed with the query's result. The query may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the query is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

The return type is determined by the given query.

methods.name: query
methods.documentation:
Sends a query with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the query's result.

The return type is determined by the given query.

methods.name: query
methods.documentation:
Sends the given query and returns a future that will be completed with the query's result. The query may be an
 instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the query is published using the
 passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: query
methods.documentation:
Sends a query with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the query's
 result.

methods.name: queryAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given query and returns the query's result. The query may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the query is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

The return type is determined by the given query.

methods.name: queryAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends a query with given payload and metadata and returns the query's result.

The return type is determined by the given query.

methods.name: queryAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given query and returns the query's result. The query may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which
 case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the query is published using the passed value as payload without
 additional metadata.

methods.name: queryAndWait
methods.documentation: Sends a query with given payload and metadata and returns the query's result.

methods.name: queryGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for query messages.

methods.name: registerHandlers
methods.documentation:
Registers given handlers and initiates message tracking (i.e. listening for messages).

The given handlers will be inspected for annotated handler methods (e.g. methods annotated with {@link HandleCommand}). Depending on this inspection message tracking will commence for any handled message types. To stop listening at any time invoke {@link Registration#cancel()} on the returned object.

Note that an exception may be thrown if tracking for a given message type is already in progress.

If any of the handlers is a local handler or contains local handler methods, i.e. if type or method is annotated with {@link LocalHandler}, the target object will (also) be registered as local handler. Local handlers will handle messages in the publishing thread. If a published message can be handled locally it will not be published to the Fluxzero Runtime. Local handling of messages may come in handy in several situations: e.g. when the message is expressly meant to be handled only by the current application or if the message needs to be handled as quickly as possible. However, in most cases it will not be necessary to register local handlers.

Note that it will generally not be necessary to invoke this method manually if you use Spring to configure your application. @see FluxzeroSpringConfig for more info on how to configure your application using Spring @see LocalHandler for more info on local handlers.

methods.name: registerHandlers
methods.documentation:
Registers given handlers and initiates message tracking.

 @see #registerHandlers(Object...) for more info

methods.name: resultGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for result messages sent by handlers of commands and queries.

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedule a message object (of type {@link Schedule}) for execution, using the {@link Guarantee#SENT} guarantee.

 @param schedule the message to schedule

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedule a message object (of type {@link Schedule}) for execution, using the {@link Guarantee#SENT} guarantee.

 @param schedule the message to schedule

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedules a message with given {@code scheduleId} after given delay. The {@code schedule} parameter may be an
 instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the schedule is published
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedules a message with given {@code scheduleId} for the given timestamp. The {@code schedule} parameter may be
 an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the schedule is published
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedules a message after the given delay, returning the schedule's id. The {@code schedule} parameter may be an
 instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the schedule is published
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: schedule
methods.documentation:
Schedules a message for the given timestamp, returning the schedule's id. The {@code schedule} parameter may be
 an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the schedule is published
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation: Schedule a command using the given scheduling settings, using the {@link Guarantee#SENT} guarantee.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation:
Schedule a command using the given scheduling settings if no other with same ID exists, using the
 {@link Guarantee#SENT} guarantee.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation:
Schedules a command with given {@code scheduleId} after given delay. The {@code command} parameter may be an
 instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the command is published using
 the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation:
Schedules a command with given {@code scheduleId} for the given timestamp. The {@code command} parameter may be
 an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the command is published
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation:
Schedules a command after given delay, returning the command schedule's id. The {@code command} parameter may be
 an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the command is scheduled
 using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: scheduleCommand
methods.documentation:
Schedules a command for the given timestamp, returning the command schedule's id. The {@code command} parameter
 may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be scheduled as is. Otherwise, the command is
 scheduled using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: schedulePeriodic
methods.documentation:
Starts a new periodic schedule, returning the schedule's id. The {@code schedule} parameter may be an instance of
 a {@link Message} or the schedule payload. If the payload is not annotated with {@link Periodic} an
 {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown.

 @see Periodic

methods.name: schedulePeriodic
methods.documentation:
Starts a new periodic schedule using given schedule id. The {@code schedule} parameter may be an instance of a
 {@link Message} or the schedule payload. If the payload is not annotated with {@link Periodic} an
 {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown.

 @see Periodic

methods.name: search
search
methods.documentation:
Search the given collection for documents. Usually collection is the String name of the collection. However, it is also possible to call it with a {@link Collection} containing one or multiple collection names.

If collection is of type {@link Class} it is expected that the class is annotated with {@link Searchable}. It will then use the collection configured there.

For all other inputs, the collection name will be obtained by calling {@link Object#toString()} on the input.

Example usage: Fluxzero.search("myCollection").query("foo !bar").fetch(100);

methods.name: search
methods.documentation:
Search the given collections for documents.

If collection is of type {@link Class} it is expected that the class is annotated with * {@link Searchable}. It will then use the collection configured there. For all other inputs, the collection name will be obtained by calling {@link Object#toString()} on the input.

Example usage: Fluxzero.search("myCollection", "myOtherCollection).query("foo !bar").fetch(100);

methods.name: sendAndForgetCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends the given command and doesn't wait for a result. The command may be an instance of a {@link Message} in
 which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise the command is published using the passed value as payload without
 additional metadata.

 @see #sendCommand(Object) to send a command and inspect its result asynchronously

methods.name: sendAndForgetCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends a command with given payload and metadata and don't wait for a result.

 @see #sendCommand(Object, Metadata) to send a command and inspect its result

methods.name: sendAndForgetCommand
sendAndForgetCommands
methods.documentation:
Sends the given commands and doesn't wait for results. Commands may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which
 case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the commands are published using the passed value as payload without
 additional metadata.

 @see #sendCommands(Object...)  to send commands and inspect their results asynchronously

methods.name: sendCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends the given command and returns a future that will be completed with the command's result. The command may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise the command is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

The return type is determined by the given command.

methods.name: sendCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends a command with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the command's result.

The return type is determined by the given command.

methods.name: sendCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends the given command and returns a future that will be completed with the command's result. The command may be
 an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise the command is published using
 the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: sendCommand
methods.documentation:
Sends a command with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the command's
 result.

methods.name: sendCommandAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given command and returns the command's result. The command may be an instance of a {@link Message} in which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the command is published using the passed value as payload without additional metadata.

The return type is determined by the given command.

methods.name: sendCommandAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends a command with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the command's result.

The return type is determined by the given command.

methods.name: sendCommandAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given command and returns the command's result. The command may be an instance of a {@link Message} in
 which case it will be sent as is. Otherwise, the command is published using the passed value as payload without
 additional metadata.

methods.name: sendCommandAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends a command with given payload and metadata and returns a future that will be completed with the command's
 result.

methods.name: sendCommands
methods.documentation:
Sends the given commands and returns a list of futures that will be completed with the commands' results. The
 commands may be instances of a {@link Message} in which case they will be sent as is. Otherwise, the commands are
 published using the passed values as payload without additional metadata.

methods.name: sendWebRequest
methods.documentation:
Sends the given web request using default request settings and returns a future that completes with the response.

The request must have an absolute URL to be forwarded by the Fluxzero proxy.

methods.name: sendWebRequest
methods.documentation:
Sends the given web request using the given request settings and returns a future that completes with the response.

The request must have an absolute URL to be forwarded by the Fluxzero proxy.

methods.name: sendWebRequestAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given web request using default request settings and waits for the response synchronously.

This method blocks the calling thread until the request is completed or times out.

The request must have an absolute URL to be forwarded by the Fluxzero proxy.

methods.name: sendWebRequestAndWait
methods.documentation:
Sends the given web request using given request settings and waits for the response synchronously.

This method blocks the calling thread until the request is completed or times out.

The request must have an absolute URL to be forwarded by the Fluxzero proxy.

methods.name: serializer
methods.documentation: Returns the default serializer

methods.name: snapshotStore
methods.documentation: Returns the store for aggregate snapshots.

methods.name: taskScheduler
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link TaskScheduler} of this Fluxzero instance.

methods.name: tracking
methods.documentation: Returns a client to assist with the tracking of a given message type.

methods.name: userProvider
methods.documentation:
Returns the UserProvider used by Fluxzero to authenticate users. May be {@code null} if user authentication is
 disabled.

methods.name: webRequestGateway
methods.documentation: Returns the gateway for sending web requests.

methods.name: withClock
methods.documentation: Have Fluxzero use the given Clock when generating timestamps, e.g. when creating a {@link Message}.
